name: TI_2_1_4_3_Disable_Decision_Support_Alerts_Clinical_Audit_Trigger
title: TI.2.1.4.3 Disable Decision Support Alerts Clinical Audit Trigger (Function)
description: Manage Audit Trigger initiated to track disabling of decision support alerts.
purpose: Capture disabling of decision support alerts, both routine and exceptional, including key metadata (who, what, when, where, why).

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL audit each occurrence when decision support alerts are disabled according to scope of practice, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the organization.

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#03
statement.requirement: IF known, THEN the system SHALL capture identity of the user.

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the system.

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the event initiating audit trigger.

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#06
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the date and time of the event initiating audit trigger.

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#07
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the location (i.e., network address).

statement.label: TI.2.1.4.3#08
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the rationale for disabling clinical alerts.
